titlepage:
\begin{titlepage}

\title{Spectral flow of the Dirac spectrum in intersecting 
vortices\footnote{supported by DFG under grant-No. DFG-Re
856/5-1}}

\author{H.~Reinhardt, T.~Tok\\
\vspace{0.5cm}
University of T\"ubingen}

\maketitle

\vspace{2cm}




\normalsize

\begin{abstract} 
The spectrum of the Dirac Hamiltonian in the background of
crossing vortices is studied. To exploit the index theorem, and in
analogy to the lattice the space-time manifold is chosen to be
the four-torus $\T^4$. For sake of simplicity we consider two idealized 
cases: infinitely fat and infinitely thin transversally intersecting
vortices. The time-dependent spectrum
of the Dirac Hamiltonian is calculated and in particular the 
influence of the vortex crossing on the quark spectrum is investigated.
\end{abstract}
\vskip .5truecm
\noindent PACS: 11.15.-q, 12.38.Aw

\noindent Keywords: Yang-Mills theory, center vortices, index theorem,
zero modes

\
